channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘This is a wacky number’: economists cry foul as new government data assumes zero housing inflation in surprising November drop
item.description: The culprit, several economists say, is the extended government shutdown.

item.title: Trump’s Truth Social Just Inked a $6 Billion Merger in Perhaps the Most Bizarre M&A Deal of 2025
item.description: President Trump’s social media platform plans to merge with a nearly 30-year-old energy company, providing it with some $300 million in funding.

item.title: Lovable hits $6.6 billion valuation as its CEO says it wants to be ‘the last piece of software’ companies ever buy

item.title: How Salient, an AI loan processing startup valued at $500 million, grew ARR to $25 million in two years
item.description: Salient cofounder Ari Malik built AI to automate loan servicing, turning collections calls into a high-growth business now valued around $500 million.

item.title: How to Help Your Company’s AI Training Keep Pace With Your Employees’ Use of It
item.description: New data show exactly how enthusiastic people are about using AI at work, even if it’s in a risky way.
